texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RECRUITMENT SELECTION POLICY AND PROCEDURE
texts.text: RECRUITMENT SELECTION POLICY AND PROCEDURE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As per recruitment and selection policy, the process of talent acquisition starts from  recruitment  and  is  processed  further  with  selection  and  continues  till induction.  Selection  is  the  process  of  choosing  the  best  person  for  a  given position. Recruitment is attraction and selection is to choose. Induction means introducing the person to the position. In other words, we can say the success of the  company  is  based  on  the  right  recruitment  to  a  very  large  extent  as  the process of recruitment is based on proper strategies.
texts.text: As per recruitment and selection policy, the process of talent acquisition starts from  recruitment  and  is  processed  further  with  selection  and  continues  till induction.  Selection  is  the  process  of  choosing  the  best  person  for  a  given position. Recruitment is attraction and selection is to choose. Induction means introducing the person to the position. In other words, we can say the success of the  company  is  based  on  the  right  recruitment  to  a  very  large  extent  as  the process of recruitment is based on proper strategies.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The five steps involved in recruitment process are as follows:
texts.text: The five steps involved in recruitment process are as follows:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: OFFICE DRESS CODE POLICY
texts.text: OFFICE DRESS CODE POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  purpose  of  this  policy  is  to  establish  guidelines  for  appropriate  attire and appearance in the workplace, ensuring professionalism and maintaining a positive work environment.
texts.text: The  purpose  of  this  policy  is  to  establish  guidelines  for  appropriate  attire and appearance in the workplace, ensuring professionalism and maintaining a positive work environment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees are  expected  to  dress  in formal attire  -  male  in  formal  collar shirt, format pant, coat and female in formal collar shirt, formal pant, kurta.
texts.text: Employees are  expected  to  dress  in formal attire  -  male  in  formal  collar shirt, format pant, coat and female in formal collar shirt, formal pant, kurta.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees must always present a clean, professional appearance. Everyone is expected to be well-groomed and wear clean clothing, free of holes, tears, or other signs of wear.
texts.text: Employees must always present a clean, professional appearance. Everyone is expected to be well-groomed and wear clean clothing, free of holes, tears, or other signs of wear.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Clothing with offensive or inappropriate designs or stamps are not allowed.
texts.text: Clothing with offensive or inappropriate designs or stamps are not allowed.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: On Saturday, employee have choice to wear casual dress. Examples of acceptable casual attire include: Jeans or casual pants, collar T-shirts or casual collar shirts and sweaters or pullovers
texts.text: On Saturday, employee have choice to wear casual dress. Examples of acceptable casual attire include: Jeans or casual pants, collar T-shirts or casual collar shirts and sweaters or pullovers

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: BOND POLICY
texts.text: BOND POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A  bond  is  a  legal  agreement  between  the  employee  and  the  company, usually requiring the employee to fulfill certain obligations, such as serving a specified period of employment, before being eligible for certain benefits or remuneration.
texts.text: A  bond  is  a  legal  agreement  between  the  employee  and  the  company, usually requiring the employee to fulfill certain obligations, such as serving a specified period of employment, before being eligible for certain benefits or remuneration.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Applicability:
texts.text: Applicability:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Bonds may be applicable to certain categories of employees, such as: New hires undergoing specialized training or certification.
texts.text: Bonds may be applicable to certain categories of employees, such as: New hires undergoing specialized training or certification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees sponsored for further education or professional development.
texts.text: Employees sponsored for further education or professional development.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees assigned to critical projects or roles.
texts.text: Employees assigned to critical projects or roles.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Bond Duration:
texts.text: Bond Duration:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The duration of the bond will be specified in the bond agreement and may vary depending on the circumstances, such as the nature of the training or project.
texts.text: The duration of the bond will be specified in the bond agreement and may vary depending on the circumstances, such as the nature of the training or project.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Consequences of Breach:
texts.text: Consequences of Breach:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the event of a breach of the bond agreement, such as resignation before the completion of the bond period, employees may be required to:
texts.text: In the event of a breach of the bond agreement, such as resignation before the completion of the bond period, employees may be required to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ➢ Repay the company for any training costs or expenses incurred.
texts.text: Repay the company for any training costs or expenses incurred.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ➢ Face legal consequences as outlined in the bond agreement, including penalties or legal action.
texts.text: Face legal consequences as outlined in the bond agreement, including penalties or legal action.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Bond Release:
texts.text: Bond Release:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Upon  successful  completion  of  the  bond  period  and  fulfillment  of  all obligations, employees will be released from the bond agreement.
texts.text: Upon  successful  completion  of  the  bond  period  and  fulfillment  of  all obligations, employees will be released from the bond agreement.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employees may be required to sign a bond release document confirming the satisfactory completion of the bond period.
texts.text: Employees may be required to sign a bond release document confirming the satisfactory completion of the bond period.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Implementation:
texts.text: Implementation:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The HR department will oversee the drafting, execution, and  management of  bond  agreements. Employees  entering  into  bond  agreements  will  be provided  with  copies  of  the  agreement  and  any  associated  documents  for their records.
texts.text: The HR department will oversee the drafting, execution, and  management of  bond  agreements. Employees  entering  into  bond  agreements  will  be provided  with  copies  of  the  agreement  and  any  associated  documents  for their records.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: LEAVE POLICY
texts.text: LEAVE POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A leave policy is a set  of  guidelines  and  procedures  that  govern  the  usage  of various  types  of  leaves  available  to  employees  within  an  organization.  This policy  aims  to  ensure  fair  treatment,  consistent  application  of  rules,  and compliance with legal requirements.
texts.text: A leave policy is a set  of  guidelines  and  procedures  that  govern  the  usage  of various  types  of  leaves  available  to  employees  within  an  organization.  This policy  aims  to  ensure  fair  treatment,  consistent  application  of  rules,  and compliance with legal requirements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If anybody takes 2 days off from work, for instance it is Saturday and Monday as  annual  leaves,  then  here  instead  of  deducting  2  leaves  from  annual  leave balance, it will be deducted 3 leaves, as the Sunday has been sandwiched, so it will come under the sandwich rule. During Probation, there is no leave.
texts.text: If anybody takes 2 days off from work, for instance it is Saturday and Monday as  annual  leaves,  then  here  instead  of  deducting  2  leaves  from  annual  leave balance, it will be deducted 3 leaves, as the Sunday has been sandwiched, so it will come under the sandwich rule. During Probation, there is no leave.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 12 days annually will be work from home, that means 2 days in a month. After any holidays or week off work from home is not allow. For PL, at least before a week leave dates should be uploaded in HRM Portal as well as mail to Reporting lead and HR Team.
texts.text: 12 days annually will be work from home, that means 2 days in a month. After any holidays or week off work from home is not allow. For PL, at least before a week leave dates should be uploaded in HRM Portal as well as mail to Reporting lead and HR Team.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Here's a detailed explanation of key components often found in a leave policy:
texts.text: Here's a detailed explanation of key components often found in a leave policy:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  consideration  of  work-life  balance,  we  are  offering  two  options  for Privilege Leave (PL) Balance:
texts.text: In  consideration  of  work-life  balance,  we  are  offering  two  options  for Privilege Leave (PL) Balance:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Encashment: to  convert  maximum  5  days  of  accumulated  PL  into monetary  compensation  or carry  forward: to  carry  forward  maximum  5 days  of  PL  to  the  next  calendar  year,  providing  a  greater  flexibility  with time off.
texts.text: Encashment: to  convert  maximum  5  days  of  accumulated  PL  into monetary  compensation  or carry  forward: to  carry  forward  maximum  5 days  of  PL  to  the  next  calendar  year,  providing  a  greater  flexibility  with time off.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Approval from HR Head and Team Lead for any leave is mandatory.
texts.text: Approval from HR Head and Team Lead for any leave is mandatory.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Note: Those who work at client site, leaves will be granted as per the client list.
texts.text: Note: Those who work at client site, leaves will be granted as per the client list.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: BENCH POLICY
texts.text: BENCH POLICY

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The following points are to be considered for the Bench Policy at Indigi -
texts.text: The following points are to be considered for the Bench Policy at Indigi -

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Bench Any employee who is not productive or not working in any project or in the 3 rd  stage of PIP (Performance Improvement Plan) will be termed as non productive.
texts.text: Bench Any employee who is not productive or not working in any project or in the 3 rd  stage of PIP (Performance Improvement Plan) will be termed as non productive.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As the employee could not be utilized in any of the ongoing project or internal assignments,  the  output  of  the  employee  cannot  be  measured  upon  and  such employee will be termed as 'Bench'.
texts.text: As the employee could not be utilized in any of the ongoing project or internal assignments,  the  output  of  the  employee  cannot  be  measured  upon  and  such employee will be termed as 'Bench'.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The applicability of Bench management policies:
texts.text: The applicability of Bench management policies:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Types of Employees Covered:
texts.text: 1. Types of Employees Covered:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Categories of employees who are subject to bench management policies.
texts.text: Categories of employees who are subject to bench management policies.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This may include:
texts.text: This may include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Consultants: External resources hired on a project basis.
texts.text: Consultants: External resources hired on a project basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Project-based  employees:  Internal  employees  whose  roles  are  tied  to specific projects.
texts.text: Project-based  employees:  Internal  employees  whose  roles  are  tied  to specific projects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Contractors: Individuals engaged on a temporary basis for project work.
texts.text: Contractors: Individuals engaged on a temporary basis for project work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Any  other relevant employee  groups that may  experience periods between project assignments.
texts.text: Any  other relevant employee  groups that may  experience periods between project assignments.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Criteria for Inclusion:
texts.text: 2. Criteria for Inclusion:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The criteria or conditions that determine when an employee falls under bench management policies.
texts.text: The criteria or conditions that determine when an employee falls under bench management policies.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This could include:
texts.text: This could include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees awaiting assignment to a new project after completing  their current assignment.
texts.text: Employees awaiting assignment to a new project after completing  their current assignment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees transitioning between projects within the organization.
texts.text: Employees transitioning between projects within the organization.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees  whose  project  assignments  have  ended  and  are  awaiting reassignment or redeployment.
texts.text: Employees  whose  project  assignments  have  ended  and  are  awaiting reassignment or redeployment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3. Effective Period:
texts.text: 3. Effective Period:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Specify when  bench  management  policies come  into effect for eligible employees. This may vary based on organizational needs and practices. For example:
texts.text: Specify when  bench  management  policies come  into effect for eligible employees. This may vary based on organizational needs and practices. For example:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Bench  management  policies  may  apply  during  periods  of  project transition, when employees are between project assignments.
texts.text: Bench  management  policies  may  apply  during  periods  of  project transition, when employees are between project assignments.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Policies  may  also  apply  during  any  period  when  an  employee  is  not actively engaged in billable client work.
texts.text: Policies  may  also  apply  during  any  period  when  an  employee  is  not actively engaged in billable client work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Bench management policies may be in effect throughout an employee's tenure with the organization, as bench periods can occur at various points in an employee's career.
texts.text: Bench management policies may be in effect throughout an employee's tenure with the organization, as bench periods can occur at various points in an employee's career.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4. Exclusions:
texts.text: 4. Exclusions:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Any  exceptions  or  exclusions  to  the  applicability  of  bench  management policies. This could include:
texts.text: Any  exceptions  or  exclusions  to  the  applicability  of  bench  management policies. This could include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees  on  approved  leaves  of  absence  (e.g.,  maternity  leave, sabbatical).
texts.text: Employees  on  approved  leaves  of  absence  (e.g.,  maternity  leave, sabbatical).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees  in  roles  that  are  not  project-based  and  do  not  typically experience bench periods.
texts.text: Employees  in  roles  that  are  not  project-based  and  do  not  typically experience bench periods.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Any other specific situations or circumstances where bench management policies may not apply.
texts.text: Any other specific situations or circumstances where bench management policies may not apply.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If there is no project or work due to no sales, then the consultants who are on a bench will  be not termed as Bench.
texts.text: If there is no project or work due to no sales, then the consultants who are on a bench will  be not termed as Bench.

texts.orig: TRAVEL RULES
texts.text: TRAVEL RULES

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When employees travel for company-related purposes, it is Indigi Consulting and  Solutions  Private  Limited  responsibility  to  provide  safe  and  reliable travel arrangements. This company travel policy serves to clarify the conditions and parameters of a company-paid trip.
texts.text: When employees travel for company-related purposes, it is Indigi Consulting and  Solutions  Private  Limited  responsibility  to  provide  safe  and  reliable travel arrangements. This company travel policy serves to clarify the conditions and parameters of a company-paid trip.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Purpose
texts.text: Purpose

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The purpose of this company travel policy is to (a) outline the authorization and reimbursement process for travel arrangements and expenses; (b) to list the  company-paid  travel  expenses;  and  (c)  to  establish  protocols  that oversee the travel arrangement process
texts.text: The purpose of this company travel policy is to (a) outline the authorization and reimbursement process for travel arrangements and expenses; (b) to list the  company-paid  travel  expenses;  and  (c)  to  establish  protocols  that oversee the travel arrangement process

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Scope
texts.text: Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This company travel policy is applicable to all employees of Indigi Consulting and Solutions, including paid interns, contractors  and full-time  employees. Indigi  will  pay  travelling  expense  if  any  employee  travel  out  of  the  city, state, and/or country.

texts.text: TRAVEL ARRANGEMENT

While traveling, employees will be  able  to  use  a  uber/  ola  taxi  service  from  and  to  the  airport,  hotel,  and business  location.  If  an  employee  wishes  to  travel  for  personal  reasons, he/she will be responsible for the travel fair.

texts.orig: Objective

texts.label: text

In the context of this policy, the accommodation  refers  to  shared  company  accommodation.  This  document covers  process  and  policies  regarding  allocation,  stay  and  management  of  the company accommodation.
texts.text: In order to provide employees with hassle free stay and comfort of working, company offers accommodation. In the context of this policy, the accommodation  refers  to  shared  company  accommodation.  This  document covers  process  and  policies  regarding  allocation,  stay  and  management  of  the company accommodation.

texts.orig: ASSETS IN ACCOMMODATION
texts.text: ASSETS IN ACCOMMODATION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Accommodation  should  be  without  any  asset  or  property  like  furniture, equipment, Instruments at the time of agreement.
texts.text: Accommodation  should  be  without  any  asset  or  property  like  furniture, equipment, Instruments at the time of agreement.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Allocation  of  company  accommodation  would  be  done  by  HR.  Only  those· employees who have been allocated to the Guest house are allowed to stay in the guest house.
texts.text: Allocation  of  company  accommodation  would  be  done  by  HR.  Only  those· employees who have been allocated to the Guest house are allowed to stay in the guest house.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Letter  of  allocation  will  be  provided  by  HR  to  every  occupant  before occupying the company accommodation.
texts.text: Letter  of  allocation  will  be  provided  by  HR  to  every  occupant  before occupying the company accommodation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: During Admin visit to Guest house employee may have to produce ID card or letter  of  authorization,  if  needed  for  verification  purpose. Occupant's friends,  relatives  or  any  unauthorized  person(s)  are  not  allowed  to  occupy guest house for any period of time.
texts.text: During Admin visit to Guest house employee may have to produce ID card or letter  of  authorization,  if  needed  for  verification  purpose. Occupant's friends,  relatives  or  any  unauthorized  person(s)  are  not  allowed  to  occupy guest house for any period of time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Any  event of an unauthorized person(s) found occupying the  company accommodation will lead to strict action against the employee.
texts.text: Any  event of an unauthorized person(s) found occupying the  company accommodation will lead to strict action against the employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Also occupants would be jointly responsible in case any authorized per- son(s) is / are allowed to stay in company accommodation.
texts.text: Also occupants would be jointly responsible in case any authorized per- son(s) is / are allowed to stay in company accommodation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Occupants  shall  deposit  the  room  keys  and  allocation  letter  to  the  Ad-  min when they leave the company accommodation.
texts.text: Occupants  shall  deposit  the  room  keys  and  allocation  letter  to  the  Ad-  min when they leave the company accommodation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Basic Guidelines for accommodation
texts.text: Basic Guidelines for accommodation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Smoking, tobacco, gutka, any illegal substance and alcohol consumption are not permitted at company accommodation.
texts.text: Smoking, tobacco, gutka, any illegal substance and alcohol consumption are not permitted at company accommodation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Occupants are advised not to keep valuables  in the company accommodation and they will be responsible for the safety of valuable items if kept in the rooms.
texts.text: Occupants are advised not to keep valuables  in the company accommodation and they will be responsible for the safety of valuable items if kept in the rooms.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Visitors  coming  to  see  an  employee  staying  in  the  company  accommodation should meet them in outside area and are not allowed to visit the rooms of the Guest house.
texts.text: Visitors  coming  to  see  an  employee  staying  in  the  company  accommodation should meet them in outside area and are not allowed to visit the rooms of the Guest house.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Occupants are advised to keep noise levels to minimum which should not affect the neighbors. Any complaints coming from neighbors or land- lord will be addressed and action will be taken on concerned occupants.
texts.text: Occupants are advised to keep noise levels to minimum which should not affect the neighbors. Any complaints coming from neighbors or land- lord will be addressed and action will be taken on concerned occupants.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Occupants are advised to keep company accommodation clean and to best  of hygiene  condition.  This  is  directly  linked  to  the  health  and  safety  of occupants.
texts.text: Occupants are advised to keep company accommodation clean and to best  of hygiene  condition.  This  is  directly  linked  to  the  health  and  safety  of occupants.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Occupants  may  come  from  diverse  background  and  are  advised  to  live  at company  accommodation  with  peace  and  harmony  and  respect  for  each other,  neighbors  and  outsiders.  Any  events  of  misbehavior,  quarrel  between occupants or with outsiders will lead to strict action against the concerned person.
texts.text: Occupants  may  come  from  diverse  background  and  are  advised  to  live  at company  accommodation  with  peace  and  harmony  and  respect  for  each other,  neighbors  and  outsiders.  Any  events  of  misbehavior,  quarrel  between occupants or with outsiders will lead to strict action against the concerned person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · In case an occupant has to give residential address to any outside authority private  or  government,  they  need  a  written  permission  from  regional  HR head.  In  either  case  company  will  not  be  responsible  for  any  litigation  or obligation arising from the same.
texts.text: In case an occupant has to give residential address to any outside authority private  or  government,  they  need  a  written  permission  from  regional  HR head.  In  either  case  company  will  not  be  responsible  for  any  litigation  or obligation arising from the same.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Occupants are advised to go through the copy of company accommodation legal  agreement.  Apart  from  the  terms  and  conditions  mentioned  in  this policy  document,  occupants  will  have  to  abide  by  terms  and  conditions mentioned in the company accommodation legal agreement. texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ANTI-HARASSMENT AND NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY
texts.text: ANTI-HARASSMENT AND NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Indigi  is  committed  to  providing  a  work  environment  that  is  free  from harassment  and  discrimination.  We  believe  in  treating  all  employees  with dignity and respect, and we prohibit any form of harassment or discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or
texts.text: Indigi  is  committed  to  providing  a  work  environment  that  is  free  from harassment  and  discrimination.  We  believe  in  treating  all  employees  with dignity and respect, and we prohibit any form of harassment or discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: expression, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
texts.text: expression, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Prohibition of Harassment:
texts.text: 1. Prohibition of Harassment:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Harassment  of  any  kind,  including  but  not  limited  to  verbal, physical, or visual harassment, is strictly prohibited. This includes derogatory  comments,  jokes,  gestures,  or  any  other  behavior  that creates a hostile or offensive work environment.
texts.text: Harassment  of  any  kind,  including  but  not  limited  to  verbal, physical, or visual harassment, is strictly prohibited. This includes derogatory  comments,  jokes,  gestures,  or  any  other  behavior  that creates a hostile or offensive work environment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Prohibition of Discrimination:
texts.text: 2. Prohibition of Discrimination:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Discrimination based on any protected characteristic is prohibited. This includes decisions regarding hiring, promotion, compensation, benefits, and any other terms and conditions of employment.
texts.text: Discrimination based on any protected characteristic is prohibited. This includes decisions regarding hiring, promotion, compensation, benefits, and any other terms and conditions of employment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3. Reporting Procedure:
texts.text: 3. Reporting Procedure:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees who experience or witness harassment or discrimination are encouraged to report it promptly to their supervisor,  manager,  HR  department,  or  any  other  designated company representative.
texts.text: Employees who experience or witness harassment or discrimination are encouraged to report it promptly to their supervisor,  manager,  HR  department,  or  any  other  designated company representative.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Reports will be investigated promptly and impartially, and appropriate action will be taken to address the situation.
texts.text: Reports will be investigated promptly and impartially, and appropriate action will be taken to address the situation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4. Non-Retaliation:
texts.text: 4. Non-Retaliation:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Indigi  prohibits  retaliation  against  any  individual  who  reports harassment  or  discrimination,  participates  in  an  investigation,  or opposes  unlawful  practices.  Retaliation  against  such  individuals will not be tolerated and may result in disciplinary action.
texts.text: Indigi  prohibits  retaliation  against  any  individual  who  reports harassment  or  discrimination,  participates  in  an  investigation,  or opposes  unlawful  practices.  Retaliation  against  such  individuals will not be tolerated and may result in disciplinary action.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5. Training and Awareness:
texts.text: 5. Training and Awareness:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Indigi  will  provide  regular  training  and  awareness  programs  to employees  to  educate  them  about  the  importance  of  preventing harassment and discrimination in the workplace.
texts.text: Indigi  will  provide  regular  training  and  awareness  programs  to employees  to  educate  them  about  the  importance  of  preventing harassment and discrimination in the workplace.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Training will cover topics such as identifying prohibited behavior, reporting  procedures,  and  promoting  a  culture  of  respect  and inclusivity.
texts.text: Training will cover topics such as identifying prohibited behavior, reporting  procedures,  and  promoting  a  culture  of  respect  and inclusivity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Compliance:
texts.text: Compliance:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All employees are expected to comply with this policy and contribute to maintaining a workplace free from harassment and discrimination.
texts.text: All employees are expected to comply with this policy and contribute to maintaining a workplace free from harassment and discrimination.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Violations  of  this  policy  may  result  in  disciplinary  action,  up  to  and including termination of employment.
texts.text: Violations  of  this  policy  may  result  in  disciplinary  action,  up  to  and including termination of employment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: HEALTH AND SAFETY POLICY
texts.text: HEALTH AND SAFETY POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Safety  and  health  policies  are  comprehensive  documents  that  outline  an organization's  commitment to providing a safe and healthy work environment for its employees. These policies typically cover a wide range of areas related to workplace  safety,  health,  and  well-being.  Here  are  some  common  elements included in safety and health policies:
texts.text: Safety  and  health  policies  are  comprehensive  documents  that  outline  an organization's  commitment to providing a safe and healthy work environment for its employees. These policies typically cover a wide range of areas related to workplace  safety,  health,  and  well-being.  Here  are  some  common  elements included in safety and health policies:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Commitment to Safety and Health: The policy should begin with a statement expressing the organization's commitment to ensuring the safety and health of its employees.
texts.text: Commitment to Safety and Health: The policy should begin with a statement expressing the organization's commitment to ensuring the safety and health of its employees.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Legal  Compliance: It should outline the organization's commitment  to complying with all relevant health and safety laws, regulations, and standards.
texts.text: Legal  Compliance: It should outline the organization's commitment  to complying with all relevant health and safety laws, regulations, and standards.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Responsibilities: Clearly  define  the  roles  and  responsibilities  of  management, supervisors,  employees,  and  any  other  relevant  parties  in  ensuring  safety  and health in the workplace.
texts.text: Responsibilities: Clearly  define  the  roles  and  responsibilities  of  management, supervisors,  employees,  and  any  other  relevant  parties  in  ensuring  safety  and health in the workplace.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Risk Assessment  and  Hazard  Identification: Describe the process for identifying and assessing workplace hazards, as well as the measures taken to eliminate or control these hazards.
texts.text: Risk Assessment  and  Hazard  Identification: Describe the process for identifying and assessing workplace hazards, as well as the measures taken to eliminate or control these hazards.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Safety Training and Education: Detail the organization's approach to providing  safety  training  and  education  to  employees,  including  the  topics covered and the frequency of training.
texts.text: Safety Training and Education: Detail the organization's approach to providing  safety  training  and  education  to  employees,  including  the  topics covered and the frequency of training.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Emergency Preparedness: Outline procedures for responding to emergencies such as fires, natural disasters, medical emergencies, and other incidents.
texts.text: Emergency Preparedness: Outline procedures for responding to emergencies such as fires, natural disasters, medical emergencies, and other incidents.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): Specify the requirements for the use of PPE  in the workplace and procedures for selecting, providing, and maintaining PPE.
texts.text: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): Specify the requirements for the use of PPE  in the workplace and procedures for selecting, providing, and maintaining PPE.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Incident  Reporting  and  Investigation: Describe  the  process  for  reporting workplace  incidents,  near  misses,  and  injuries,  as  well  as  the  investigation procedures to determine the root causes and implement corrective actions.
texts.text: Incident  Reporting  and  Investigation: Describe  the  process  for  reporting workplace  incidents,  near  misses,  and  injuries,  as  well  as  the  investigation procedures to determine the root causes and implement corrective actions.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Safety Inspections and Audits: Detail the frequency and process for conducting safety inspections and audits to identify any deficiencies and ensure compliance with safety policies and procedures.
texts.text: Safety Inspections and Audits: Detail the frequency and process for conducting safety inspections and audits to identify any deficiencies and ensure compliance with safety policies and procedures.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Health  Promotion: Include  initiatives  and  programs  aimed  at  promoting employee  health and well-being, such as wellness programs,  ergonomic assessments, and mental health support services.
texts.text: Health  Promotion: Include  initiatives  and  programs  aimed  at  promoting employee  health and well-being, such as wellness programs,  ergonomic assessments, and mental health support services.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Continuous  Improvement: Emphasize  the organization's  commitment  to continuous  improvement  in  safety  and  health  performance  through  regular monitoring, evaluation, and feedback mechanisms.
texts.text: Continuous  Improvement: Emphasize  the organization's  commitment  to continuous  improvement  in  safety  and  health  performance  through  regular monitoring, evaluation, and feedback mechanisms.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Communication: Outline  the  channels  of  communication  for  safety-related information, including how employees can raise safety concerns or suggestions for improvement.
texts.text: Communication: Outline  the  channels  of  communication  for  safety-related information, including how employees can raise safety concerns or suggestions for improvement.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Review and Revision: Specify  how  the  policy  will  be  periodically  reviewed, updated,  and  communicated  to  employees  to  ensure  its  effectiveness  and relevance.
texts.text: Review and Revision: Specify  how  the  policy  will  be  periodically  reviewed, updated,  and  communicated  to  employees  to  ensure  its  effectiveness  and relevance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: SMOKING AND TOBACCO POLICY
texts.text: SMOKING AND TOBACCO POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  purpose  of  this  Smoking  Policy  is  to  provide  guidelines  and  regulations regarding smoking and tobacco use within Indigi's premises to ensure a healthy and safe working environment for all employees.
texts.text: The  purpose  of  this  Smoking  Policy  is  to  provide  guidelines  and  regulations regarding smoking and tobacco use within Indigi's premises to ensure a healthy and safe working environment for all employees.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Smoking Restrictions:
texts.text: Smoking Restrictions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Indoor  Smoking: Smoking is  strictly  prohibited  within  all  indoor  areas  of Indigi's premises, including offices, meeting rooms, corridors, stairwells, restrooms, and common areas.
texts.text: Indoor  Smoking: Smoking is  strictly  prohibited  within  all  indoor  areas  of Indigi's premises, including offices, meeting rooms, corridors, stairwells, restrooms, and common areas.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Designated Smoking Areas: Designated smoking areas may be provided in outdoor  areas  of  the  premises,  subject  to  compliance  with  local  laws  and regulations.  These  areas  will  be  clearly  marked,  and  employees  must  use designated smoking areas if they choose to smoke.
texts.text: Designated Smoking Areas: Designated smoking areas may be provided in outdoor  areas  of  the  premises,  subject  to  compliance  with  local  laws  and regulations.  These  areas  will  be  clearly  marked,  and  employees  must  use designated smoking areas if they choose to smoke.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Tobacco Products:
texts.text: Tobacco Products:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  addition  to  traditional  cigarettes,  this  policy  also  applies  to  all  forms  of tobacco  and  nicotine  products,  including  but  not  limited  to  cigars,  pipes, electronic cigarettes, vaping devices, chewing tobacco, and snuff.
texts.text: In  addition  to  traditional  cigarettes,  this  policy  also  applies  to  all  forms  of tobacco  and  nicotine  products,  including  but  not  limited  to  cigars,  pipes, electronic cigarettes, vaping devices, chewing tobacco, and snuff.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Responsibilities:
texts.text: Responsibilities:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Employee  Compliance: All  employees  are  expected  to  comply  with  this Smoking Policy and respect the rights of non-smokers.
texts.text: Employee  Compliance: All  employees  are  expected  to  comply  with  this Smoking Policy and respect the rights of non-smokers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Supervisor  Responsibility: Supervisors  and  managers  are  responsible  for ensuring that employees under their supervision are aware of and adhere to this policy.
texts.text: Supervisor  Responsibility: Supervisors  and  managers  are  responsible  for ensuring that employees under their supervision are aware of and adhere to this policy.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Enforcement:
texts.text: Enforcement:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Disciplinary  Action: Violation  of  this  Smoking  Policy  may  result  in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment, in accordance with Indigi's disciplinary procedures.
texts.text: Disciplinary  Action: Violation  of  this  Smoking  Policy  may  result  in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment, in accordance with Indigi's disciplinary procedures.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Reporting  Violations: Employees  who  observe  violations  of  this  policy should report them to their supervisor or the Human Resources department for appropriate action.
texts.text: Reporting  Violations: Employees  who  observe  violations  of  this  policy should report them to their supervisor or the Human Resources department for appropriate action.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Health and Safety Considerations:
texts.text: Health and Safety Considerations:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This  policy  is  implemented  to  promote  the  health  and  well-being  of  all employees  and  visitors,  reduce  exposure  to  secondhand  smoke,  and  comply with applicable health and safety regulations.
texts.text: This  policy  is  implemented  to  promote  the  health  and  well-being  of  all employees  and  visitors,  reduce  exposure  to  secondhand  smoke,  and  comply with applicable health and safety regulations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Communication and Training:
texts.text: Communication and Training:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Indigi will provide training and communication regarding this Smoking Policy to all employees and ensure that it is readily available to all employees through employee handbooks, intranet, or other communication channels.
texts.text: Indigi will provide training and communication regarding this Smoking Policy to all employees and ensure that it is readily available to all employees through employee handbooks, intranet, or other communication channels.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ALCOHOL AND DRUG POLICY
texts.text: ALCOHOL AND DRUG POLICY

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Prohibited Activities:
texts.text: Prohibited Activities:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Alcohol Consumption : The consumption of alcoholic beverages is prohibited  on  Indigi's  premises  during  working  hours,  including  breaks  and lunch periods.
texts.text: Alcohol Consumption : The consumption of alcoholic beverages is prohibited  on  Indigi's  premises  during  working  hours,  including  breaks  and lunch periods.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b )  Drug  Use: The  use,  possession,  distribution,  or  sale  of  illegal  drugs  or unauthorized prescription  drugs  is  strictly  prohibited  on  company  premises  or while conducting business-related activities.
texts.text: b )  Drug  Use: The  use,  possession,  distribution,  or  sale  of  illegal  drugs  or unauthorized prescription  drugs  is  strictly  prohibited  on  company  premises  or while conducting business-related activities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Impairment and Safety:
texts.text: Impairment and Safety:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Impairment: Employees are prohibited from reporting to work or performing  their  duties  while  under  the  influence  of  alcohol,  illegal  drugs,  or prescription drugs that impair their ability to work safely and effectively.
texts.text: Impairment: Employees are prohibited from reporting to work or performing  their  duties  while  under  the  influence  of  alcohol,  illegal  drugs,  or prescription drugs that impair their ability to work safely and effectively.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Safety Sensitive Positions: Employees in safety-sensitive positions, such as those operating machinery, driving vehicles, or performing hazardous tasks, are subject to stricter regulations regarding alcohol and drug use.
texts.text: Safety Sensitive Positions: Employees in safety-sensitive positions, such as those operating machinery, driving vehicles, or performing hazardous tasks, are subject to stricter regulations regarding alcohol and drug use.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Testing and Screening:
texts.text: Testing and Screening:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Pre-Employment  Screening: Prospective  employees  may  be  required  to undergo pre-employment medical as a condition of employment.
texts.text: Pre-Employment  Screening: Prospective  employees  may  be  required  to undergo pre-employment medical as a condition of employment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Reasonable  Suspicion  Testing: Employees  may  be  subject  to  drug  and alcohol testing if there is reasonable suspicion of substance abuse, impairment, or violation of company policy.
texts.text: Reasonable  Suspicion  Testing: Employees  may  be  subject  to  drug  and alcohol testing if there is reasonable suspicion of substance abuse, impairment, or violation of company policy.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Consequences of Violation:
texts.text: Consequences of Violation:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Disciplinary Action: Violation of this Alcohol and Drug Policy may result in  disciplinary  action,  up  to  and  including  termination  of  employment,  in accordance with company policies and procedures.
texts.text: Disciplinary Action: Violation of this Alcohol and Drug Policy may result in  disciplinary  action,  up  to  and  including  termination  of  employment,  in accordance with company policies and procedures.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Legal Consequences: Employees found to be in violation of this policy may also  be  subject  to  legal  consequences,  including  fines,  penalties,  and  criminal charges, if applicable.
texts.text: Legal Consequences: Employees found to be in violation of this policy may also  be  subject  to  legal  consequences,  including  fines,  penalties,  and  criminal charges, if applicable.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: DISCIPLINE POLICY
texts.text: DISCIPLINE POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: To establish clear guidelines and procedures for addressing employee misconduct, maintaining a positive work environment, and promoting adherence to company policies and standards of conduct.
texts.text: To establish clear guidelines and procedures for addressing employee misconduct, maintaining a positive work environment, and promoting adherence to company policies and standards of conduct.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Standards of Conduct:
texts.text: Standards of Conduct:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Compliance: Employees are expected to comply with all company policies, procedures, and applicable laws and regulations.
texts.text: Compliance: Employees are expected to comply with all company policies, procedures, and applicable laws and regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Professionalism: Employees  are  expected  to  demonstrate  professionalism, respect,  and  integrity  in  their  interactions  with  colleagues,  customers,  and stakeholders.
texts.text: Professionalism: Employees  are  expected  to  demonstrate  professionalism, respect,  and  integrity  in  their  interactions  with  colleagues,  customers,  and stakeholders.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Disciplinary Actions:
texts.text: Disciplinary Actions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Progressive Discipline: The company may employ a progressive discipline approach, which typically includes verbal warnings, written warnings, suspension,  and  termination,  depending  on  the  severity  and  recurrence  of  the misconduct.
texts.text: Progressive Discipline: The company may employ a progressive discipline approach, which typically includes verbal warnings, written warnings, suspension,  and  termination,  depending  on  the  severity  and  recurrence  of  the misconduct.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Types of  Misconduct: Examples  of misconduct that may  result in disciplinary action include but are not limited to:
texts.text: Types of  Misconduct: Examples  of misconduct that may  result in disciplinary action include but are not limited to:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Investigation Process:
texts.text: Investigation Process:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Fair Process: All allegations of misconduct will be promptly and thoroughly investigated in a fair and impartial manner.
texts.text: Fair Process: All allegations of misconduct will be promptly and thoroughly investigated in a fair and impartial manner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Confidentiality :  Information  related  to  disciplinary  matters  will  be  kept confidential to the extent possible, while still ensuring a thorough investigation and appropriate action.
texts.text: Confidentiality :  Information  related  to  disciplinary  matters  will  be  kept confidential to the extent possible, while still ensuring a thorough investigation and appropriate action.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMAIL POLICY
texts.text: EMAIL POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Email Policy is to establish guidelines for the appropriate use of company email systems  to  ensure  efficient  communication,  protect  sensitive  information,  and maintain professional standards.
texts.text: Email Policy is to establish guidelines for the appropriate use of company email systems  to  ensure  efficient  communication,  protect  sensitive  information,  and maintain professional standards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Acceptable Use:
texts.text: Acceptable Use:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Professional  Communication: Company email systems are to be used for business-related  communications  only.  Personal  use  should  be  kept  to  a minimum and should not interfere with job responsibilities.
texts.text: Professional  Communication: Company email systems are to be used for business-related  communications  only.  Personal  use  should  be  kept  to  a minimum and should not interfere with job responsibilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Confidentiality: Employees  are  responsible  for  safeguarding  confidential and proprietary information when using email. Confidential information should not be transmitted via email unless necessary and appropriate security measures are in place.
texts.text: Confidentiality: Employees  are  responsible  for  safeguarding  confidential and proprietary information when using email. Confidential information should not be transmitted via email unless necessary and appropriate security measures are in place.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Prohibited Activities:
texts.text: Prohibited Activities:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Unauthorized Access: Users are prohibited from accessing or attempting to access email accounts belonging to other individuals without proper authorization.
texts.text: Unauthorized Access: Users are prohibited from accessing or attempting to access email accounts belonging to other individuals without proper authorization.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Misuse: Email  systems  must  not  be  used  for  activities  that  are  illegal, unethical,  or  could  damage  the  company's  reputation  or  operations.  This includes, but is not limited to, sending spam, chain letters, or malicious content.
texts.text: Misuse: Email  systems  must  not  be  used  for  activities  that  are  illegal, unethical,  or  could  damage  the  company's  reputation  or  operations.  This includes, but is not limited to, sending spam, chain letters, or malicious content.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Security Measures:
texts.text: Security Measures:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Password Protection: Users  are  responsible  for  creating  strong  passwords and keeping them confidential. Passwords should not be shared with others or stored in an insecure manner.
texts.text: Password Protection: Users  are  responsible  for  creating  strong  passwords and keeping them confidential. Passwords should not be shared with others or stored in an insecure manner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Anti-Virus Protection: Employees should ensure that their devices have upto-date  anti-virus  software  installed  to  prevent  the  spread  of  malware  and viruses through email attachments.
texts.text: Anti-Virus Protection: Employees should ensure that their devices have upto-date  anti-virus  software  installed  to  prevent  the  spread  of  malware  and viruses through email attachments.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Professionalism:
texts.text: Professionalism:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Respectful Communication: All email communications should be professional, respectful, and free from offensive or discriminatory language.
texts.text: Respectful Communication: All email communications should be professional, respectful, and free from offensive or discriminatory language.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Signature: Employees  are  encouraged  to  include  a  professional  email signature  containing  their  name,  job  title,  contact  information,  and  company logo, where applicable.
texts.text: Signature: Employees  are  encouraged  to  include  a  professional  email signature  containing  their  name,  job  title,  contact  information,  and  company logo, where applicable.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Monitoring and Enforcement:
texts.text: Monitoring and Enforcement:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Monitoring: The  company  reserves  the  right  to  monitor  email  usage  to ensure compliance with this policy and applicable laws.
texts.text: Monitoring: The  company  reserves  the  right  to  monitor  email  usage  to ensure compliance with this policy and applicable laws.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Enforcement: Violation  of  this  Email  Policy  may  result  in  disciplinary action,  up  to  and  including  termination  of  employment,  in  accordance  with company policies and procedures.
texts.text: Enforcement: Violation  of  this  Email  Policy  may  result  in  disciplinary action,  up  to  and  including  termination  of  employment,  in  accordance  with company policies and procedures.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: INTERNET USE POLICY
texts.text: INTERNET USE POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Internet  Use  Policy  is  to  establish  guidelines  for  the  appropriate  use  of  the internet  and  company  network  resources  to  ensure  productivity,  protect  data security, and maintain a professional work environment.
texts.text: Internet  Use  Policy  is  to  establish  guidelines  for  the  appropriate  use  of  the internet  and  company  network  resources  to  ensure  productivity,  protect  data security, and maintain a professional work environment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Acceptable Use:
texts.text: Acceptable Use:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Business Purposes: The internet and company network resources are to be used  primarily  for  business-related  activities  that  support  job  responsibilities and company objectives.
texts.text: Business Purposes: The internet and company network resources are to be used  primarily  for  business-related  activities  that  support  job  responsibilities and company objectives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Compliance: Users  must comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and company policies when accessing the internet and company network resources.
texts.text: Compliance: Users  must comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and company policies when accessing the internet and company network resources.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Prohibited Activities:
texts.text: Prohibited Activities:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Illegal Activities: Users are prohibited from engaging in any illegal activities while using company internet and network resources, including but not limited to, accessing or distributing illegal content, hacking, or copyright infringement.
texts.text: Illegal Activities: Users are prohibited from engaging in any illegal activities while using company internet and network resources, including but not limited to, accessing or distributing illegal content, hacking, or copyright infringement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Unauthorized Access: Users must not attempt to gain unauthorized access to restricted websites, systems, or data, or share login credentials with unauthorized individuals.
texts.text: Unauthorized Access: Users must not attempt to gain unauthorized access to restricted websites, systems, or data, or share login credentials with unauthorized individuals.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Security Measures:
texts.text: Security Measures:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Password Protection: Users  are  responsible  for  creating  strong  passwords and  safeguarding  them  from  unauthorized  access.  Passwords  should  not  be shared or stored in an insecure manner.
texts.text: Password Protection: Users  are  responsible  for  creating  strong  passwords and  safeguarding  them  from  unauthorized  access.  Passwords  should  not  be shared or stored in an insecure manner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Malware Protection: Devices used to access company internet and network resources must have up-to-date anti-virus and anti-malware software installed to prevent security breaches.
texts.text: Malware Protection: Devices used to access company internet and network resources must have up-to-date anti-virus and anti-malware software installed to prevent security breaches.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Personal Use:
texts.text: Personal Use:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Limited  Personal  Use: Limited  personal  use  of  company  internet  and network  resources  may  be  permitted  during  non-working  hours,  provided  it does not interfere with job responsibilities or violate company policies.
texts.text: Limited  Personal  Use: Limited  personal  use  of  company  internet  and network  resources  may  be  permitted  during  non-working  hours,  provided  it does not interfere with job responsibilities or violate company policies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Content Filtering: Access to certain websites or content categories may be restricted  or  filtered  by  the  company's  network  security  measures to minimize security risks and maintain productivity.
texts.text: Content Filtering: Access to certain websites or content categories may be restricted  or  filtered  by  the  company's  network  security  measures to minimize security risks and maintain productivity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Monitoring and Enforcement:
texts.text: Monitoring and Enforcement:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Monitoring: The company reserves the right to monitor internet usage and network  traffic  to  ensure  compliance  with  this  policy  and  identify  potential security threats or misuse.
texts.text: Monitoring: The company reserves the right to monitor internet usage and network  traffic  to  ensure  compliance  with  this  policy  and  identify  potential security threats or misuse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Enforcement: Violations of this Internet Use Policy may  result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment, in accordance with company policies and procedures.
texts.text: Enforcement: Violations of this Internet Use Policy may  result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment, in accordance with company policies and procedures.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CELL PHONE POLICY
texts.text: CELL PHONE POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This policy applies to all employees,  contractors, and  visitors accessing company premises or engaged in company-related activities.
texts.text: This policy applies to all employees,  contractors, and  visitors accessing company premises or engaged in company-related activities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Acceptable Use:
texts.text: Acceptable Use:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Business Purposes: Cell phones may be used for business-related communications and tasks necessary to fulfill job responsibilities.
texts.text: Business Purposes: Cell phones may be used for business-related communications and tasks necessary to fulfill job responsibilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Emergency Situations: Cell  phones  may  be  used  in  emergency  situations where immediate communication is essential for safety or security reasons.
texts.text: Emergency Situations: Cell  phones  may  be  used  in  emergency  situations where immediate communication is essential for safety or security reasons.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Prohibited Activities:
texts.text: Prohibited Activities:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Personal  Calls  During  Work  Hours: Personal  calls  should  be  limited during work  hours  and  should  not interfere with job responsibilities or productivity.
texts.text: Personal  Calls  During  Work  Hours: Personal  calls  should  be  limited during work  hours  and  should  not interfere with job responsibilities or productivity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Inappropriate  Content: Employees  must  not  access,  download,  or  share inappropriate or unauthorized content using company-provided cell phones.
texts.text: Inappropriate  Content: Employees  must  not  access,  download,  or  share inappropriate or unauthorized content using company-provided cell phones.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Confidentiality and Privacy:
texts.text: Confidentiality and Privacy:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Sensitive  Information: Employees  must  exercise  caution  when  discussing sensitive  or  confidential  information  over  cell  phones  to  prevent  unauthorized access or disclosure.
texts.text: Sensitive  Information: Employees  must  exercise  caution  when  discussing sensitive  or  confidential  information  over  cell  phones  to  prevent  unauthorized access or disclosure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Lost  or  Stolen  Devices: Employees must report lost or stolen cell  phones immediately to the IT department to prevent unauthorized access to company data.
texts.text: Lost  or  Stolen  Devices: Employees must report lost or stolen cell  phones immediately to the IT department to prevent unauthorized access to company data.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Safety Guidelines:
texts.text: Safety Guidelines:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Driving  and  Cell  Phone  Use: Employees  are  prohibited  from  using  cell phones  while  operating  company  vehicles  or  while  driving  on  company business to prevent accidents and ensure road safety.
texts.text: Driving  and  Cell  Phone  Use: Employees  are  prohibited  from  using  cell phones  while  operating  company  vehicles  or  while  driving  on  company business to prevent accidents and ensure road safety.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Enforcement:
texts.text: Enforcement:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Violation Consequences: Violations of this Cell Phone Policy may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment, depending on the severity of the offense and its impact on company operations.
texts.text: Violation Consequences: Violations of this Cell Phone Policy may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment, depending on the severity of the offense and its impact on company operations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: GRIEVANCE POLICY
texts.text: GRIEVANCE POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Grievance Policy is designed to provide employees with a formal process to address and resolve workplace grievances promptly, fairly, and confidentially.
texts.text: The Grievance Policy is designed to provide employees with a formal process to address and resolve workplace grievances promptly, fairly, and confidentially.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Reporting Procedure:
texts.text: Reporting Procedure:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Informal Resolution: Employees are encouraged to first attempt to resolve grievances informally by discussing the issue with their immediate supervisor and HR representative.
texts.text: Informal Resolution: Employees are encouraged to first attempt to resolve grievances informally by discussing the issue with their immediate supervisor and HR representative.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Formal Grievance: If the grievance cannot be resolved informally or if the employee  is  uncomfortable  discussing  the  matter  with  their  supervisor,  they may submit a formal written grievance to the ombudsmen or to HR.
texts.text: Formal Grievance: If the grievance cannot be resolved informally or if the employee  is  uncomfortable  discussing  the  matter  with  their  supervisor,  they may submit a formal written grievance to the ombudsmen or to HR.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Grievance Handling Process:
texts.text: Grievance Handling Process:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Investigation: HR will conduct a thorough investigation, which may involve interviewing relevant parties, gathering evidence, and reviewing relevant documentation.
texts.text: Investigation: HR will conduct a thorough investigation, which may involve interviewing relevant parties, gathering evidence, and reviewing relevant documentation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Resolution: HR  will  work  towards  resolving  the  grievance  promptly  and fairly.  Depending  on  the  nature  of  the  grievance,  resolution  may  involve mediation, corrective action, or other appropriate measures.
texts.text: Resolution: HR  will  work  towards  resolving  the  grievance  promptly  and fairly.  Depending  on  the  nature  of  the  grievance,  resolution  may  involve mediation, corrective action, or other appropriate measures.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Confidentiality:
texts.text: Confidentiality:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All parties involved in the grievance process, including the employee raising the grievance  and  those  involved  in  the  investigation,  are  expected  to  maintain confidentiality to the extent possible to protect the privacy and interests of all parties.
texts.text: All parties involved in the grievance process, including the employee raising the grievance  and  those  involved  in  the  investigation,  are  expected  to  maintain confidentiality to the extent possible to protect the privacy and interests of all parties.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Appeals Process:
texts.text: Appeals Process:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If the employee is not satisfied with the outcome of the grievance process, they may  have  the  option  to  appeal  the  decision  to  a  higher  authority  within  the company, such as senior management or an independent review panel.
texts.text: If the employee is not satisfied with the outcome of the grievance process, they may  have  the  option  to  appeal  the  decision  to  a  higher  authority  within  the company, such as senior management or an independent review panel.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Non-Retaliation:
texts.text: Non-Retaliation:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employees are protected from retaliation for raising a grievance in good faith. Any acts of retaliation against an employee for filing a grievance will be subject to disciplinary action.
texts.text: Employees are protected from retaliation for raising a grievance in good faith. Any acts of retaliation against an employee for filing a grievance will be subject to disciplinary action.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VISITOR POLICY
texts.text: VISITOR POLICY

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Visitor Registration:
texts.text: Visitor Registration:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Check-In  Procedure: All  visitors must  check  in  at  the  reception  or designated  check-in  area  upon  arrival.  They  will  be  required  to  provide identification and sign in, including details such as name, organization, purpose of visit, and contact information.
texts.text: Check-In  Procedure: All  visitors must  check  in  at  the  reception  or designated  check-in  area  upon  arrival.  They  will  be  required  to  provide identification and sign in, including details such as name, organization, purpose of visit, and contact information.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Escort Requirement:
texts.text: Escort Requirement:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Escort  by  Host: Visitors  must  be  escorted  by  their  host  or  a  designated employee  at  all  times  while  on  Indigi's  premises,  especially  when  accessing restricted areas or sensitive areas.
texts.text: Escort  by  Host: Visitors  must  be  escorted  by  their  host  or  a  designated employee  at  all  times  while  on  Indigi's  premises,  especially  when  accessing restricted areas or sensitive areas.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Host  Responsibility: Hosts  are  responsible  for  ensuring  that  their  visitors comply with Indigi's policies and procedures, including safety regulations and confidentiality requirements.
texts.text: Host  Responsibility: Hosts  are  responsible  for  ensuring  that  their  visitors comply with Indigi's policies and procedures, including safety regulations and confidentiality requirements.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Access Restrictions:
texts.text: Access Restrictions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Restricted  Areas: Visitors  are  not  permitted  to  access  restricted  areas without prior authorization from their host and appropriate security clearance.
texts.text: Restricted  Areas: Visitors  are  not  permitted  to  access  restricted  areas without prior authorization from their host and appropriate security clearance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Confidential Information: Visitors must not have access to confidential or proprietary  information  unless  necessary  for  the  purpose  of  their  visit  and authorized by Indigi.
texts.text: Confidential Information: Visitors must not have access to confidential or proprietary  information  unless  necessary  for  the  purpose  of  their  visit  and authorized by Indigi.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Conduct and Behavior:
texts.text: Conduct and Behavior:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Professionalism: Visitors are expected to conduct themselves in a professional manner and adhere to Indigi's code of conduct and ethics.
texts.text: Professionalism: Visitors are expected to conduct themselves in a professional manner and adhere to Indigi's code of conduct and ethics.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: b) Compliance: Visitors must comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and I's  policies,  including  those  related  to  health  and  safety,  security,  and  data protection.
texts.text: b) Compliance: Visitors must comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and I's  policies,  including  those  related  to  health  and  safety,  security,  and  data protection.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Parking and Transportation:
texts.text: Parking and Transportation:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Visitors  must  comply  with  parking  regulations  and  instructions  provided  by Indigi's  staff.  Parking  spaces  may  be  limited,  and  alternative  transportation options may be recommended.
texts.text: Visitors  must  comply  with  parking  regulations  and  instructions  provided  by Indigi's  staff.  Parking  spaces  may  be  limited,  and  alternative  transportation options may be recommended.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Visitor Log:
texts.text: Visitor Log:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A record of all visitor entries and exits, including their details and purpose of visit, will be maintained for security and record-keeping purposes.
texts.text: A record of all visitor entries and exits, including their details and purpose of visit, will be maintained for security and record-keeping purposes.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: DATA PRIVACY AND CONFIDENTIALITY
texts.text: DATA PRIVACY AND CONFIDENTIALITY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: we  are committed to protecting the privacy and confidentiality of our employees, customers, business partners, and other  stakeholders'  personal  and sensitive information. This Data Privacy and Confidentiality Policy outlines our approach  to  managing  and  safeguarding  data  to  ensure  compliance  with applicable laws and regulations and maintain trust and confidence.
texts.text: we  are committed to protecting the privacy and confidentiality of our employees, customers, business partners, and other  stakeholders'  personal  and sensitive information. This Data Privacy and Confidentiality Policy outlines our approach  to  managing  and  safeguarding  data  to  ensure  compliance  with applicable laws and regulations and maintain trust and confidence.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Policy Statement:
texts.text: Policy Statement:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Scope: This  policy  applies  to  all  employees,  contractors,  vendors,  and  third parties who have access to or handle personal or sensitive information on behalf of Indigi.
texts.text: Scope: This  policy  applies  to  all  employees,  contractors,  vendors,  and  third parties who have access to or handle personal or sensitive information on behalf of Indigi.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data  Collection  and  Use: We  will  only  collect  personal  information  that  is necessary for legitimate business purposes and obtain consent from individuals before  collecting,  using,  or  disclosing  their  data,  except  where  permitted  or required by law.
texts.text: Data  Collection  and  Use: We  will  only  collect  personal  information  that  is necessary for legitimate business purposes and obtain consent from individuals before  collecting,  using,  or  disclosing  their  data,  except  where  permitted  or required by law.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Confidentiality: All employees must treat personal and sensitive information as confidential and refrain from disclosing, sharing, or accessing such information except as necessary to perform their job duties and responsibilities.
texts.text: Confidentiality: All employees must treat personal and sensitive information as confidential and refrain from disclosing, sharing, or accessing such information except as necessary to perform their job duties and responsibilities.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data  Security: We  will  implement  appropriate  technical,  administrative,  and physical  security  measures  to  protect  personal  and  sensitive  information  from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.
texts.text: Data  Security: We  will  implement  appropriate  technical,  administrative,  and physical  security  measures  to  protect  personal  and  sensitive  information  from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data  Retention: We  will  retain  personal  information  only  for  as  long  as necessary  to  fulfill  the  purposes  for  which  it  was  collected  or  as  required  by applicable laws and regulations. We will securely dispose of or anonymize data when it is no longer needed.
texts.text: Data  Retention: We  will  retain  personal  information  only  for  as  long  as necessary  to  fulfill  the  purposes  for  which  it  was  collected  or  as  required  by applicable laws and regulations. We will securely dispose of or anonymize data when it is no longer needed.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Third-Party Access: We will only share personal information with third parties who  have  a  legitimate  need  to  access  such  information  and  have  agreed  to comply with our data privacy and confidentiality requirements.
texts.text: Third-Party Access: We will only share personal information with third parties who  have  a  legitimate  need  to  access  such  information  and  have  agreed  to comply with our data privacy and confidentiality requirements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data  Subject  Rights: We  will  respect  individuals'  rights  regarding  their personal  data,  including  the  right  to  access,  correct,  delete,  or  restrict  the processing of their information, as required by applicable data protection laws.
texts.text: Data  Subject  Rights: We  will  respect  individuals'  rights  regarding  their personal  data,  including  the  right  to  access,  correct,  delete,  or  restrict  the processing of their information, as required by applicable data protection laws.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data  Breach  Response: We  will  promptly  investigate  and  respond  to  any suspected or confirmed data breaches, notify affected individuals and authorities as required by law, and take appropriate measures to mitigate the impact of the breach.
texts.text: Data  Breach  Response: We  will  promptly  investigate  and  respond  to  any suspected or confirmed data breaches, notify affected individuals and authorities as required by law, and take appropriate measures to mitigate the impact of the breach.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Training  and  Awareness: We  will  provide  regular  training  and  awareness programs  to  educate  employees  about  their  responsibilities  regarding  data privacy and confidentiality and promote a culture of privacy awareness.
texts.text: Training  and  Awareness: We  will  provide  regular  training  and  awareness programs  to  educate  employees  about  their  responsibilities  regarding  data privacy and confidentiality and promote a culture of privacy awareness.

texts.label: text

texts.orig: The  purpose  of  this  Corporate  Security  Policy  is  to  establish  guidelines  and procedures to safeguard Indigi's employees, assets, information, and reputation from security threats and risks.

Access  control  mechanisms  such  as  key  cards,  biometric  authentication,  and security personnel will be implemented as necessary.
