texts.text: TERMINATION AND SEPARATION POLICY

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Grounds for Termination:
texts.text: 1. Grounds for Termination:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Indigi  reserves  the  right  to  terminate  your  employment  without  notice  or compensation in the event of:
texts.text: Indigi  reserves  the  right  to  terminate  your  employment  without  notice  or compensation in the event of:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Misconduct, Negligence, or Breach of Terms: If  you are found guilty of misconduct,  negligence,  or  breach  of  the  terms  and  conditions  of  your employment, or any misdemeanor that affects the company's reputation or business operations.
texts.text: Misconduct, Negligence, or Breach of Terms: If  you are found guilty of misconduct,  negligence,  or  breach  of  the  terms  and  conditions  of  your employment, or any misdemeanor that affects the company's reputation or business operations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Unauthorized Absence: If you remain absent from work without authorization or reasonable explanation for more than three (3) consecutive days,  it  will  be  considered  voluntary  abandonment  of  duties,  and  your employment will be terminated.
texts.text: Unauthorized Absence: If you remain absent from work without authorization or reasonable explanation for more than three (3) consecutive days,  it  will  be  considered  voluntary  abandonment  of  duties,  and  your employment will be terminated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) Incompleteness or Misrepresentation: If it is discovered that you provided incomplete or misrepresented information during the hiring process, leading to the  termination  of  your  employment.  Additionally,  the  company  reserves  the right  to  claim  damages  equal  to  recruitment  and  background  verification expenses.
texts.text: Incompleteness or Misrepresentation: If it is discovered that you provided incomplete or misrepresented information during the hiring process, leading to the  termination  of  your  employment.  Additionally,  the  company  reserves  the right  to  claim  damages  equal  to  recruitment  and  background  verification expenses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) Refusal  of  Duties: If  you  refuse  to  carry  out  your  assigned  duties  and responsibilities or tasks assigned by those in authority.
texts.text: Refusal  of  Duties: If  you  refuse  to  carry  out  your  assigned  duties  and responsibilities or tasks assigned by those in authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) Misconduct or Disloyalty: If  there  is  reasonable  suspicion  of  misconduct, disloyalty, moral turpitude, indiscipline, inefficiency, harassment, or any other behavior deemed detrimental to the company's interests.
texts.text: Misconduct or Disloyalty: If  there  is  reasonable  suspicion  of  misconduct, disloyalty, moral turpitude, indiscipline, inefficiency, harassment, or any other behavior deemed detrimental to the company's interests.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Termination Procedure:
texts.text: 2. Termination Procedure:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the event of termination under any of the aforementioned circumstances, your employment will be terminated immediately, and you will be required to return all company property in your possession.
texts.text: In the event of termination under any of the aforementioned circumstances, your employment will be terminated immediately, and you will be required to return all company property in your possession.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3 . No Compensation:
texts.text: 3 . No Compensation:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: You  will  not  be  entitled  to  any  compensation  or  notice  period  in  case  of termination under these circumstances.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: OMBUDSMAN POLICY
texts.text: OMBUDSMAN POLICY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Ombudsman at Indigi serves as an independent, impartial, and confidential resource for employees  to  voice concerns, address grievances, and seek resolution to workplace issues. The purpose of this policy is to outline the role, responsibilities, and procedures of the Ombudsman.
texts.text: The Ombudsman at Indigi serves as an independent, impartial, and confidential resource for employees  to  voice concerns, address grievances, and seek resolution to workplace issues. The purpose of this policy is to outline the role, responsibilities, and procedures of the Ombudsman.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Role and Responsibilities:
texts.text: Role and Responsibilities:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Independence: The Ombudsman Office operates independently from management and other organizational entities, ensuring impartiality and confidentiality in its processes.
texts.text: Independence: The Ombudsman Office operates independently from management and other organizational entities, ensuring impartiality and confidentiality in its processes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Confidentiality: All  communications  with  the  Ombudsman  are  confidential, and  information  disclosed  during  the  resolution  process  will  not  be  disclosed without the express consent of the individual(s) involved, except as required by law.
texts.text: Confidentiality: All  communications  with  the  Ombudsman  are  confidential, and  information  disclosed  during  the  resolution  process  will  not  be  disclosed without the express consent of the individual(s) involved, except as required by law.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Neutral Facilitation: The Ombudsman  serves  as a neutral third party, facilitating communication, exploring options, and assisting in resolving conflicts and disputes informally and amicably.
texts.text: Neutral Facilitation: The Ombudsman  serves  as a neutral third party, facilitating communication, exploring options, and assisting in resolving conflicts and disputes informally and amicably.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Advisory Role: The Ombudsman will provide guidance, advice, and referrals to appropriate  resources  or  services  within  the  organization  to  address  concerns effectively.
texts.text: Advisory Role: The Ombudsman will provide guidance, advice, and referrals to appropriate  resources  or  services  within  the  organization  to  address  concerns effectively.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Policy Review: The Ombudsman monitors organizational policies and practices, identifying trends, patterns, and systemic issues that may impact the work environment, and making recommendations for improvement as necessary.
texts.text: Policy Review: The Ombudsman monitors organizational policies and practices, identifying trends, patterns, and systemic issues that may impact the work environment, and making recommendations for improvement as necessary.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Procedures
texts.text: Procedures

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Confidentiality: All communications with the Ombudsman  are strictly confidential, and information shared will not be disclosed without permission, except as required by law.
texts.text: Confidentiality: All communications with the Ombudsman  are strictly confidential, and information shared will not be disclosed without permission, except as required by law.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Voluntary Participation: The Ombudsman process is voluntary, and individuals  may  choose  to  seek  assistance  or  participate  in  the  resolution process at their discretion.
texts.text: Voluntary Participation: The Ombudsman process is voluntary, and individuals  may  choose  to  seek  assistance  or  participate  in  the  resolution process at their discretion.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Informal Resolution: The Ombudsman encourages informal resolution through facilitated dialogue, mediation, or other collaborative methods aimed at resolving disputes promptly and effectively.
texts.text: Informal Resolution: The Ombudsman encourages informal resolution through facilitated dialogue, mediation, or other collaborative methods aimed at resolving disputes promptly and effectively.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Impartiality: The  Ombudsman  remains  impartial  and  neutral  throughout  the resolution  process,  advocating  for  fairness  and  equity  while  refraining  from taking sides or making judgments.
texts.text: Impartiality: The  Ombudsman  remains  impartial  and  neutral  throughout  the resolution  process,  advocating  for  fairness  and  equity  while  refraining  from taking sides or making judgments.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Documentation: The Ombudsman maintains accurate and confidential records of  all  interactions  and  communications,  ensuring  integrity,  transparency,  and accountability in the resolution process.
texts.text: Documentation: The Ombudsman maintains accurate and confidential records of  all  interactions  and  communications,  ensuring  integrity,  transparency,  and accountability in the resolution process.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Review and Revision:
texts.text: Review and Revision:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This Ombudsman Policy will be periodically reviewed and updated as necessary to ensure its effectiveness and alignment with organizational goals and values.
texts.text: This Ombudsman Policy will be periodically reviewed and updated as necessary to ensure its effectiveness and alignment with organizational goals and values.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The policy outlines the terms and condition under which employees can apply for  and  receive  loan  from  the  company  it  typically  covers  aspects  such  as eligibility criteria loan frequency interest rate repayment terms and application procedures  the  purpose  of  a  loan  policies  to  ensure  consistency  fairness  and transparency in  the  loan  process  as  well  as  to  protect  the  financial  interest  of both the employees and the organization.
texts.text: The policy outlines the terms and condition under which employees can apply for  and  receive  loan  from  the  company  it  typically  covers  aspects  such  as eligibility criteria loan frequency interest rate repayment terms and application procedures  the  purpose  of  a  loan  policies  to  ensure  consistency  fairness  and transparency in  the  loan  process  as  well  as  to  protect  the  financial  interest  of both the employees and the organization.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Eligibility: All full-time employees so have completed Six months of probationary period with the company are eligible to apply for loans.
texts.text: Eligibility: All full-time employees so have completed Six months of probationary period with the company are eligible to apply for loans.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Interest charges: If an employee applies for a loan amount exceeding their netin-hand  salary,  an  interest  charge  of  4%  will  be  applicable  on  the  excess amount.
texts.text: Interest charges: If an employee applies for a loan amount exceeding their netin-hand  salary,  an  interest  charge  of  4%  will  be  applicable  on  the  excess amount.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For example, if an employee with a net-in-hand salary of ₹30,000 applies for a loan of ₹60,000, the interest will be charged on the excess ₹30,000 at the rate of 4%.
texts.text: For example, if an employee with a net-in-hand salary of ₹30,000 applies for a loan of ₹60,000, the interest will be charged on the excess ₹30,000 at the rate of 4%.

texts.text: Loan frequency: Employees are eligible to apply for a loan once per year. Employees who have already availed of a loan within the same calendar year are  eligible  to  apply  for  a  second  loan  after  getting  approval  from  the  higher management.

texts.text: Loan  Repayment: Loan  repayment  will  be  deducted  from  the  employee's salary in equal monthly installments over a period not exceeding six months.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Spot bonuses
texts.text: Spot bonuses

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Spot bonuses or spot awards are small monetary award given to employees in direct response to an achievement. Employers give out spot bonuses as a way to give special recognition to employees working on challenging projects or taking extra initiative beyond the scope of their position. Our bonus usually doesn't have set criteria other than being a response to exceptional work.
texts.text: Spot bonuses or spot awards are small monetary award given to employees in direct response to an achievement. Employers give out spot bonuses as a way to give special recognition to employees working on challenging projects or taking extra initiative beyond the scope of their position. Our bonus usually doesn't have set criteria other than being a response to exceptional work.

texts.label: section_header

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This Project bonus usually specifies a particular deadline that employees have to  meet  in  order  to  get  monetary  reward. texts.label: text
texts.orig: Performance bonuses are regularly scheduled monetary awards that reflect employee  success.  Salespeople  earning  a  higher  commission  percentage  for making more sales are a common example of performance bonus incentives.
texts.text: Performance bonuses are regularly scheduled monetary awards that reflect employee  success.  Salespeople  earning  a  higher  commission  percentage  for making more sales are a common example of performance bonus incentives.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Our Company generally pay performance bonuses when employees contribute directly to their financial success and growth. This bonus is a popular way to track our employee performance goals and reward top performers.
texts.text: Our Company generally pay performance bonuses when employees contribute directly to their financial success and growth. This bonus is a popular way to track our employee performance goals and reward top performers.

texts.orig: Referral Bonus
texts.text: Referral Bonus

texts.text: A  referral  bonus  is  offered  to  employees  who  refer  people  to  become employees  of  the  organization  for  any  job  role.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: PERFORMANCE APPRAISAL
texts.text: PERFORMANCE APPRAISAL

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  purpose  of  this  policy  is  to  establish  guidelines  and  procedures  for conducting performance appraisals at Indigi to assess and evaluate the performance of employees.
texts.text: The  purpose  of  this  policy  is  to  establish  guidelines  and  procedures  for conducting performance appraisals at Indigi to assess and evaluate the performance of employees.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Appraisal Period:
texts.text: Appraisal Period:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Performance  appraisals  will  be  conducted  annually,  with  the  appraisal  period typically covering the previous twelve months.
texts.text: Performance  appraisals  will  be  conducted  annually,  with  the  appraisal  period typically covering the previous twelve months.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  end  of  the  year,  in  December  month,  will  be  designated  as  the  time  for conducting performance appraisals.
texts.text: The  end  of  the  year,  in  December  month,  will  be  designated  as  the  time  for conducting performance appraisals.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Objective and Fair Evaluation:
texts.text: Objective and Fair Evaluation:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Performance  evaluations  will  be  based  on  objective  criteria  relevant  to  the employee's job responsibilities, key performance indicators (KPIs), and established goals and objectives.
texts.text: Performance  evaluations  will  be  based  on  objective  criteria  relevant  to  the employee's job responsibilities, key performance indicators (KPIs), and established goals and objectives.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Evaluations will be conducted in a fair and unbiased manner, considering both quantitative and qualitative factors.
texts.text: Evaluations will be conducted in a fair and unbiased manner, considering both quantitative and qualitative factors.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Participation and Feedback:
texts.text: Participation and Feedback:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employees will have the opportunity to participate in the performance appraisal process by providing self-assessments and feedback on their performance.
texts.text: Employees will have the opportunity to participate in the performance appraisal process by providing self-assessments and feedback on their performance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Performance Ratings:
texts.text: Performance Ratings:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Performance  ratings  may  be  assigned  based  on  predefined  rating  scales  or categories, such as Far Exceed Objectives, Exceed Objectives, Meet Objectives, Partially Meet Objectives and Fail to Meet Objectives.
texts.text: Performance  ratings  may  be  assigned  based  on  predefined  rating  scales  or categories, such as Far Exceed Objectives, Exceed Objectives, Meet Objectives, Partially Meet Objectives and Fail to Meet Objectives.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Ratings should accurately reflect the employee's performance and contributions during the appraisal period.
texts.text: Ratings should accurately reflect the employee's performance and contributions during the appraisal period.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Performance Improvement Plans (PIPs):
texts.text: Performance Improvement Plans (PIPs):

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employees who receive ratings indicating areas for improvement may be placed on  Performance  Improvement  Plans  (PIPs)  to  address  specific  performance deficiencies.
texts.text: Employees who receive ratings indicating areas for improvement may be placed on  Performance  Improvement  Plans  (PIPs)  to  address  specific  performance deficiencies.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: PIPs will include clear objectives, timelines, and support mechanisms to assist employees in achieving the desired performance levels.
texts.text: PIPs will include clear objectives, timelines, and support mechanisms to assist employees in achieving the desired performance levels.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Implementation:
texts.text: Implementation:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The HR department will oversee the implementation and administration of the performance appraisal process.
texts.text: The HR department will oversee the implementation and administration of the performance appraisal process.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Managers  and  supervisors  will  be  responsible  for  conducting  performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.
texts.text: Managers  and  supervisors  will  be  responsible  for  conducting  performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.

texts.text: SALARY HIKE PERCENTAGE

texts.text: Permanent  Employees:  Yearly  (Based  on  pay  scale  and Performance) (From 5 to 50 Percentage)

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Trainee: Appraisal based on performance evaluation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Note: Trainees  or  Employees  who  go  to  PIP  (Performance  Improvement Plan), appraisal will be impacted.
texts.text: Note: Trainees  or  Employees  who  go  to  PIP  (Performance  Improvement Plan), appraisal will be impacted.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RESIGNATION POLICY
texts.text: RESIGNATION POLICY

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Resignation Process:
texts.text: Resignation Process:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees intending to resign must submit their resignation through the HRM portal.
texts.text: Employees intending to resign must submit their resignation through the HRM portal.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Notice Period:
texts.text: Notice Period:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees  are  required  to  serve  the  notice  period  specified  in  their employment letter or company policies.
texts.text: Employees  are  required  to  serve  the  notice  period  specified  in  their employment letter or company policies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The notice period allows for the completion of pending tasks, knowledge transfer, and transition planning.
texts.text: The notice period allows for the completion of pending tasks, knowledge transfer, and transition planning.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Resignation Notice:
texts.text: Resignation Notice:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The resignation notice should include the intended last working day and any relevant details regarding the resignation.
texts.text: The resignation notice should include the intended last working day and any relevant details regarding the resignation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees must provide a reason  for  their  resignation  to  facilitate  exit interviews and organizational feedback.
texts.text: Employees must provide a reason  for  their  resignation  to  facilitate  exit interviews and organizational feedback.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Exit Formalities:
texts.text: Exit Formalities:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Upon  submitting  the  resignation  notice,  employees  must  complete  all pending tasks, hand over responsibilities, and cooperate with the transition process.
texts.text: Upon  submitting  the  resignation  notice,  employees  must  complete  all pending tasks, hand over responsibilities, and cooperate with the transition process.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Exit  interviews  may  be  conducted  by  the  HR  department  to  gather feedback and insights from departing employees.
texts.text: Exit  interviews  may  be  conducted  by  the  HR  department  to  gather feedback and insights from departing employees.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Return of Company Assets:
texts.text: Return of Company Assets:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees  must  return  all  company  assets,  such  as  laptops,  access badges, keys, and other equipment, before or on their last working day.
texts.text: Employees  must  return  all  company  assets,  such  as  laptops,  access badges, keys, and other equipment, before or on their last working day.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Failure to return company asset may result in deductions from  the final settlement or other disciplinary actions.
texts.text: Failure to return company asset may result in deductions from  the final settlement or other disciplinary actions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Final Settlement:
texts.text: Final Settlement:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The  HR  department  will  process  the  final settlement for resigned employees, including payment for accrued leave, incentives, bonuses, and any other dues.
texts.text: The  HR  department  will  process  the  final settlement for resigned employees, including payment for accrued leave, incentives, bonuses, and any other dues.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The  final  settlement  will  be  disbursed  to  the  employee  through  the designated payment method specified in the HR records.
texts.text: The  final  settlement  will  be  disbursed  to  the  employee  through  the designated payment method specified in the HR records.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Implementation:
texts.text: Implementation:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Resignations  must  be  submitted  through  the  HRM  portal  to  ensure  proper documentation and adherence to company policies.
texts.text: Resignations  must  be  submitted  through  the  HRM  portal  to  ensure  proper documentation and adherence to company policies.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Managers and supervisors are responsible for supporting employees through the resignation process and facilitating a smooth transition.
texts.text: Managers and supervisors are responsible for supporting employees through the resignation process and facilitating a smooth transition.
